pikGuide.title: Primary Inspection Kiosk (PIK) Operation Guide
pikGuide.subtitle: Primary Inspection Kiosk (PIK)
pikGuide.description: Canada's border self-service kiosk is simple. Just follow this guide step by step.

step1.title: Find the Self-Service Kiosk
step1.description:
After getting off the plane, follow the "Arrivals" or "ÂÖ•Â¢É" signs.

Enter the arrival hall and look for machines with large screens.

Usually there are many machines in a row, similar in size to ATM machines.

step2.title: Select Chinese
step2.description:
The screen will display language options.

Tap "‰∏≠Êñá" or "Chinese" with your finger.

‚ö†Ô∏è If you can't find Chinese, selecting "English" is fine. The following steps all have picture prompts.

step3.title: Scan Passport
step3.description:
Open your passport to the page with your photo (photo page).

Place the passport flat with the photo facing down.

Place it on the scanner below the machine (like a copier).

When you hear a "beep" or the screen shows "‚úì", the scan is successful.

pikGuide.step3Tip: Tip: Keep the passport flat, don't bend it. If scanning fails, just place it again.

step4.title: Answer Questions
step4.description:
The screen will display several questions.

Each question has "Yes/YES" and "No/NO" buttons below.

Tap the corresponding button with your finger based on the answers below:

pikGuide.step4Warning: Important: Answer truthfully! If you answer "Yes", you may need additional checks, but there won't be any trouble.

step5.title: Take Receipt
step5.description:
After answering all questions, the machine will print a small slip.

The receipt will come out from below or the side of the machine.

‚ö†Ô∏è Be sure to keep this receipt!

You'll need to give it to the customs officer later.

step6.title: Go to Manual Counter
step6.description:
Take your passport and the receipt you just printed.

Follow the crowd and queue up to the manual counter.

Give the receipt and passport together to the customs officer.

The officer may ask a few simple questions:
‚Ä¢ What are you doing in Canada? (Tourism)
‚Ä¢ Where are you staying? (Hotel name)
‚Ä¢ How long are you staying? (A few days)

‚úÖ Done! Welcome to Canada

pikGuide.helpTitle: What if I don't know how to operate it?

helpOption1.title: Ask Staff for Help
helpOption1.description:
There are usually uniformed staff near the machines.
Say to them: "I need help"
They will help you operate it.

helpOption2.title: Ask Chinese Travelers for Help
helpOption2.description: If there are Chinese travelers nearby, you can ask them for help. Everyone is happy to help fellow countrymen.

helpOption3.title: Go to Manual Counter
helpOption3.description:
If you really don't know how to use the machine, go directly to the manual counter.
Although it's slower, you can still enter the country.
Just show the officer your passport and the form on your phone.

pikGuide.reassuranceTitle: Don't worry! No need to be nervous
pikGuide.reassuranceText:
‚Ä¢ Canadian border officers are very friendly and won't give you trouble

‚Ä¢ Many airports have Chinese service or Chinese interpreters

‚Ä¢ Even if you can't use the machine, you can use the manual channel

‚Ä¢ Millions of Chinese tourists enter Canada every year, all smoothly

Most importantly: Answer questions honestly and don't carry prohibited items
